name: satori
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing satori cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`satori` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/satoricyber/terraform-provider-satori).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing satori cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/satoricyber/terraform-provider-satori)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-satori` repo](https://github.com/satoricyber/pulumi-satori/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-satori` repo](https://github.com/satoricyber/terraform-provider-satori/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/satoricyber/terraform-provider-satori)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-satori` repo](https://github.com/satoricyber/pulumi-satori/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-satori` repo](https://github.com/satoricyber/terraform-provider-satori/issues).

serviceAccount.description: Service account ID with administrative privileges. Can be specified with the `SATORI_SA` environment variable.

serviceAccountKey.description: Service account key. Can be specified with the `SATORI_SA_KEY` environment variable.

groupId.description:
Directory group ID for identity of type GROUP.
Can not be changed after creation.

name.description:
User/group name for identity types of USER and IDP_GROUP.
Can not be changed after creation.

type.description:
Identity type, valid types are: USER, DB*USER, IDP*GROUP, GROUP, DATABRICKS*GROUP, DATABRICKS*SERVICE*PRINCIPAL, SNOWFLAKE*ROLE, EVERYONE.
Can not be changed after creation.

fieldType.description: Field type, valid types are: ANY, TEXT, NUMERIC, DATE.

valueCaseSensitive.description: Should value match be case sensitive. Defaults to `true`.

satoriBaseClassifier.description:
Base Satori classifier ID.
See https://satoricyber.com/docs/taxonomy/standard-classifiers for a list of possible values.

datasets.description: IDs of datasets to include in the scope.

includeLocations.description: Location to include in the scope.

location.description: Location for a data store. Can include only one location type field from the above: relational*location, mysql*location, athena*location, mongo*location and s3*location . Conflicts with 'relational*location' field.

relationalLocation.description: Location for a relational data store.
relationalLocation.deprecationMessage: The 'relational_location' field has been deprecated. Please use the 'location' field instead.

mysqlLocation.description: Location for MySql and MariaDB data stores.

relationalLocation.description: Location for a relational data store.

enableAccessControl.description: Enforce access control to this dataset. Defaults to `false`.

priority.description: Dataset custom policy priority. Defaults to `100`.

approvers.description: Identities of Satori users/groups that will be set as dataset approvers.

name.description: Dataset name.

owners.description: IDs of Satori users that will be set as dataset owners.

id.description: The ID of the approver entity

type.description: Approver type, can be either `GROUP` (IdP Group alone) or `USER`

location.description: Location for a data store. Can include only one location type field from the above: relational*location, mysql*location, athena*location, mongo*location and s3*location . Conflicts with 'relational*location' field.

relationalLocation.description: Location for a relational data store.
relationalLocation.deprecationMessage: The 'relational_location' field has been deprecated. Please use the 'location' field instead.

mysqlLocation.description: Location for MySql and MariaDB data stores.

relationalLocation.description: Location for a relational data store.

location.description: Location for a data store. Can include only one location type field from the above: relational*location, mysql*location, athena*location, mongo*location and s3*location . Conflicts with 'relational*location' field.

relationalLocation.description: Location for a relational data store.
relationalLocation.deprecationMessage: The 'relational_location' field has been deprecated. Please use the 'location' field instead.

mysqlLocation.description: Location for MySql and MariaDB data stores.

relationalLocation.description: Location for a relational data store.

exclusions.description: Exempt users and patterns from baseline security policy

type.description: DataStore security policy. Defaults to `BASELINE_POLICY`.

excludedIdentities.description: Exempt Users from the Baseline Security Policy

excludedQueryPatterns.description: Exempt Queries from the Baseline Security Policy

queryAction.description: Default policy action for querying locations that are not associated with a dataset, modes supported:  PASS笏コEDACT笏ィLOCK.
Default policy action for querying locations that are not associated with a dataset, modes supported:  PASS笏コEDACT笏ィLOCK.

deploymentType.description: MongoDB deployment type, for now supports only mongodb+srv and mongodb deployment

ipRanges.description: Defines IP addresses or CIDR ranges allowed to access the datastore

note.description: custom description for allowed IP ranges

ipRanges.description: Defines IP addresses or CIDR ranges allowed to access the datastore

note.description: custom description for allowed IP ranges

enablePersonalAccessToken.description: Enables Satori Personal Access Token authentication for this data store. to be able using personal access token for authentication on this data store - data store temporary credentials must be enabled and personal access token feature should be enabled for the current account (see Account setting page in Satori platform). Defaults to `false`.

enabled.description: Enables Satori Data Store authentication. Defaults to `false`.

dataStoreType.description: Data store type for member of type DB_ROLE, valid types are: SNOWFLAKE, REDSHIFT, BIGQUERY, POSTGRESQL, ATHENA, MSSQL, SYNAPSE

email.description: Member email available for types: USERNAME.

groupId.description: Directory group ID for member of type DIRECTORY_GROUP.

identityProvider.description: Identity provider type for member of type IDP_GROUP, valid identity providers are: OKTA, AZURE, ONELOGIN

name.description: Member name for types: USERNAME, IDP*GROUP and DB*ROLE.

type.description: Member type, valid types are: USERNAME, IDP*GROUP, DB*ROLE, DIRECTORY_GROUP.

Type. Can be one of [TRUNCATE, REPLACE*CHAR, REPLACE*STRING, HASH, EMAIL*PREFIX, EMAIL*SUFFIX, EMAIL*FULL, EMAIL*HASH, CREDIT*CARD*PREFIX, CREDIT*CARD*FULL, CREDIT*CARD*HASH, IP*SUFFIX, IP*FULL, IP*HASH, DATE*YEAR*ONLY, DATE*1970*AGAIN, NO*ACTION, REDACT, NUMBER*ZERO, NUMBER*ROUND, ...]

id.description: The ID of the approver entity, when type is `MANAGER` this field must not be set.

type.description: Approver type, can be either `GROUP` (IdP Group alone) or `USER`

unitType.description: Unit type for units field, possible values are: MINUTES, HOURS, DAYS, WEEKS, MONTHS, YEARS.

groupId.description:
Directory group ID for identity of type GROUP.
Can not be changed after creation.

name.description:
User/group name for identity types of USER and IDP_GROUP.
Can not be changed after creation.

type.description:
Identity type, valid types are: USER, DB*USER, IDP*GROUP, GROUP, DATABRICKS*GROUP, DATABRICKS*SERVICE*PRINCIPAL, SNOWFLAKE*ROLE, EVERYONE.
Can not be changed after creation.

id.description: Rule id, has to be unique.

maskingProfileId.description: The reference id to be applied as masking profile.

type.description:
Identity type, valid types are: USER, DB*USER, IDP*GROUP, GROUP, DATABRICKS*GROUP, DATABRICKS*SERVICE*PRINCIPAL, SNOWFLAKE*ROLE, CEL, EVERYONE.
Can not be changed after creation.

condition.description: Identity condition, for example IS_NOT, IS, etc.

identity.description: Identity to apply the rule for.

groupId.description:
Directory group ID for identity of type GROUP.
Can not be changed after creation.

name.description:
User/group name for identity types of USER and IDP_GROUP or a custom expression based on attributes of the identity for CEL identity type.
Can not be changed after creation.

type.description:
Identity type, valid types are: USER, DB*USER, IDP*GROUP, GROUP, DATABRICKS*GROUP, DATABRICKS*SERVICE*PRINCIPAL, SNOWFLAKE*ROLE, CEL, EVERYONE.
Can not be changed after creation.

defaults.description: A list of default values to be applied in this filter if there was no match. Values are dependent on their type and has to be homogeneous

name.description:
User/group name for identity types of USER and IDP_GROUP or a custom expression based on attributes of the identity for CEL identity type.
Can not be changed after creation.

type.description:
Identity type, valid types are: USER, DB*USER, IDP*GROUP, GROUP, DATABRICKS*GROUP, DATABRICKS*SERVICE*PRINCIPAL, SNOWFLAKE*ROLE, CEL, EVERYONE.
Can not be changed after creation.

values.description: List of values, when NO*VALUE or ALL*OTHER_VALUES are defined, the list has to be empty

values.description: List of values, when NO*VALUE or ALL*OTHER_VALUES are defined, the list has to be empty

id.description: Rule id, has to be unique.

advanced.description: Describes if logic yaml contains complex configuration. Defaults to `true`.

locationPrefixes.description: Location to to be included in the rule. The 'location*prefix' field has been deprecated. Please use the 'location' field instead.
locationPrefixes.deprecationMessage: The 'location_prefix' field has been deprecated. Please use the 'location' field instead.

locations.description: Location to be included in the rule.

logicYaml.description: Conditional rule, for more info see https://satoricyber.com/docs/security-policies/#setting-up-data-filtering.

mysqlLocation.description: Location for MySql and MariaDB data stores.

relationalLocation.description: Location for a relational data store.

unitType.description: Unit type for units field, possible values are: MINUTES, HOURS, DAYS, WEEKS, MONTHS, YEARS.

Directory group ID for identity of type GROUP.

provider.description:
The provider type for the satori package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

serviceAccount.description: Service account ID with administrative privileges. Can be specified with the `SATORI_SA` environment variable.

serviceAccountKey.description: Service account key. Can be specified with the `SATORI_SA_KEY` environment variable.

serviceAccount.description: Service account ID with administrative privileges. Can be specified with the `SATORI_SA` environment variable.

serviceAccountKey.description: Service account key. Can be specified with the `SATORI_SA_KEY` environment variable.

accessLevel.description: Access level to grant, valid values are: READ*ONLY, READ*WRITE, OWNER.

expireOn.description: Expire the rule on the given date and time. RFC3339 date format is expected. Time must be in UTC (i.e. YYYY-MM-DD***T***HH:MM:SS***Z***). Empty value = never expire.

identity.description: Identity to apply the rule for.

parentDataPolicy.description: Parent data policy ID, the data*policy*id field of a dataset.

revokeIfNotUsedInDays.description: Revoke access if rule not used in the last given days. Zero = do not revoke. Max value is 180. Defaults to `0`.

securityPolicies.description: IDs of security policies to apply to this rule. Empty list for default dataset security policies. [ "none" ] list for no policies.

accessLevel.description: Access level to grant, valid values are: READ*ONLY, READ*WRITE, OWNER.

identity.description: Identity to apply the rule for.

parentDataPolicy.description: Parent data policy ID, the data*policy*id field of a dataset.

revokeIfNotUsedInDays.description: Revoke access if rule not used in the last given days. Zero = do not revoke. Max value is 180. Defaults to `0`.

securityPolicies.description: IDs of security policies to apply to this rule. Empty list for default dataset security policies. [ "none" ] list for no policies.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering AccessRule resources.

accessLevel.description: Access level to grant, valid values are: READ*ONLY, READ*WRITE, OWNER.

expireOn.description: Expire the rule on the given date and time. RFC3339 date format is expected. Time must be in UTC (i.e. YYYY-MM-DD***T***HH:MM:SS***Z***). Empty value = never expire.

identity.description: Identity to apply the rule for.

parentDataPolicy.description: Parent data policy ID, the data*policy*id field of a dataset.

revokeIfNotUsedInDays.description: Revoke access if rule not used in the last given days. Zero = do not revoke. Max value is 180. Defaults to `0`.

securityPolicies.description: IDs of security policies to apply to this rule. Empty list for default dataset security policies. [ "none" ] list for no policies.

satori:index/dataset:Dataset.description:
Datasets are collections of data store locations that are meant to be governed as a single unit. The **satori_dataset** resource allows defining datasets.

The resource output includes **data_policy_id** which is mandatory ID for future access rule resources creation. See Read-Only section and **satori_request_access_rule** Resource examples. ## Example Usage ```java package generated_program; import com.pulumi.Context; import com.pulumi.Pulumi; import com.pulumi.core.Output; import com.pulumi.satori.SatoriFunctions; import com.pulumi.satori.inputs.GetUserArgs; import com.pulumi.satori.Dataset; import com.pulumi.satori.DatasetArgs; import com.pulumi.satori.inputs.DatasetDefinitionArgs; import com.pulumi.satori.inputs.DatasetAccessControlSettingsArgs; import com.pulumi.satori.inputs.DatasetCustomPolicyArgs; import java.util.List; import java.util.ArrayList; import java.util.Map; import java.io.File; import java.nio.file.Files; import java.nio.file.Paths; public class App { public static void main(String[] args) { Pulumi.run(App::stack); } public static void stack(Context ctx) { final var dataSteward1 = SatoriFunctions.getUser(GetUserArgs.builder() .email("data-steward@acme.organization") .build()); var dataset1 = new Dataset("dataset1", DatasetArgs.builder() .definition(DatasetDefinitionArgs.builder() .name("satori_dataset terraform test") .description("from satori terraform provider") .owners( "522fb8ab-8d7b-4498-b39d-6911e2839253", dataSteward1.applyValue(getUserResult -> getUserResult.id())) .approvers( DatasetDefinitionApproverArgs.builder() .type("GROUP") .id("788680b7-461d-493a-a3d6-86e71fd01ff2") .build(), DatasetDefinitionApproverArgs.builder() .type("USER") .id("3d174db4-4526-4469-2fda-46d0dd2a7f7d") .build(), DatasetDefinitionApproverArgs.builder() .type("USER") .id(dataSteward1.applyValue(getUserResult -> getUserResult.id())) .build()) .includeLocations( DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder() .datastore("12345678-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95") .build(), DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder() .datastore("80f33ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95") .location(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationArgs.builder() .relationalLocation(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationRelationalLocationArgs.builder() .db("db1") .build()) .build()) .build(), DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder() .datastore("80f33ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95") .location(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationArgs.builder() .relationalLocation(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationRelationalLocationArgs.builder() .db("db2") .schema("schema1") .build()) .build()) .build(), DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder() .datastore("80f33ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95") .location(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationArgs.builder() .relationalLocation(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationRelationalLocationArgs.builder() .db("db2") .schema("schema2") .table("table") .build()) .build()) .build()) .excludeLocations(DatasetDefinitionExcludeLocationArgs.builder() .datastore("80f33ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95") .location(DatasetDefinitionExcludeLocationLocationArgs.builder() .relationalLocation(DatasetDefinitionExcludeLocationLocationRelationalLocationArgs.builder() .db("db2") .schema("schema1") .table("tableX") .build()) .build()) .build()) .build()) .accessControlSettings(DatasetAccessControlSettingsArgs.builder() .enableAccessControl(false) .enableUserRequests(false) .enableSelfService(false) .build()) .customPolicy(DatasetCustomPolicyArgs.builder() .rulesYaml(Files.readString(Paths.get(String.format("%s/rules.yaml", path.module())))) .tagsYaml(Files.readString(Paths.get(String.format("%s/tags.yaml", path.module())))) .build()) .securityPolicies("56412aff-6ecf-4eff-9b96-2e0f6ec36c42") .build()); // Example with different location types var dataset2 = new Dataset("dataset2", DatasetArgs.builder() .definition(DatasetDefinitionArgs.builder() .name("satori_dataset terraform test") .description("from satori terraform provider") .owners( "522fb8ab-8d7b-4498-b39d-6911e2839253", dataSteward1.applyValue(getUserResult -> getUserResult.id())) .includeLocations( DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder() .datastore("12345678-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95") .build(), DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder() .datastore("80f33ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95") .location(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationArgs.builder() .relationalLocation(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationRelationalLocationArgs.builder() .db("db1") .schema("schema1") .build()) .build()) .build(), DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder() .datastore("3go33ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd5k") .location(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationArgs.builder() .mongoLocation(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationMongoLocationArgs.builder() .db("db1") .collection("collection1") .build()) .build()) .build(), DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder() .datastore("8kl43ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d508481049lw") .location(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationArgs.builder() .s3Location(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationS3LocationArgs.builder() .bucket("bucket1") .objectKey("a/b/c") .build()) .build()) .build()) .excludeLocations(DatasetDefinitionExcludeLocationArgs.builder() .datastore("80f33ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95") .location(DatasetDefinitionExcludeLocationLocationArgs.builder() .relationalLocation(DatasetDefinitionExcludeLocationLocationRelationalLocationArgs.builder() .db("db1") .schema("schema1") .table("tableX") .build()) .build()) .build()) .build()) .accessControlSettings(DatasetAccessControlSettingsArgs.builder() .enableAccessControl(false) .enableUserRequests(false) .enableSelfService(false) .build()) .customPolicy(DatasetCustomPolicyArgs.builder() .rulesYaml(Files.readString(Paths.get(String.format("%s/rules.yaml", path.module())))) .tagsYaml(Files.readString(Paths.get(String.format("%s/tags.yaml", path.module())))) .build()) .securityPolicies("56412aff-6ecf-4eff-9b96-2e0f6ec36c42") .build()); // Example with deprecated usage of relational_location field var dataset3 = new Dataset("dataset3", DatasetArgs.builder() .definition(DatasetDefinitionArgs.builder() .name("satori_dataset terraform test") .description("from satori terraform provider") .owners( "522fb8ab-8d7b-4498-b39d-6911e2839253", dataSteward1.applyValue(getUserResult -> getUserResult.id())) .includeLocations( DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder() .datastore("12345678-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95") .build(), DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder() .datastore("80f33ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95") .relationalLocation(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationRelationalLocationArgs.builder() .db("db1") .build()) .build(), DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder() .datastore("80f33ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95") .relationalLocation(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationRelationalLocationArgs.builder() .db("db2") .schema("schema1") .build()) .build(), DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder() .datastore("80f33ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95") .relationalLocation(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationRelationalLocationArgs.builder() .db("db2") .schema("schema2") .table("table") .build()) .build()) .excludeLocations(DatasetDefinitionExcludeLocationArgs.builder() .datastore("80f33ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95") .relationalLocation(DatasetDefinitionExcludeLocationRelationalLocationArgs.builder() .db("db2") .schema("schema1") .table("tableX") .build()) .build()) .build()) .accessControlSettings(DatasetAccessControlSettingsArgs.builder() .enableAccessControl(false) .enableUserRequests(false) .enableSelfService(false) .build()) .customPolicy(DatasetCustomPolicyArgs.builder() .rulesYaml(Files.readString(Paths.get(String.format("%s/rules.yaml", path.module())))) .tagsYaml(Files.readString(Paths.get(String.format("%s/tags.yaml", path.module())))) .build()) .securityPolicies("56412aff-6ecf-4eff-9b96-2e0f6ec36c42") .build()); } } ``` ```yaml resources: dataset1: type: satori:Dataset properties: definition: name: satori_dataset terraform test description: from satori terraform provider owners: - 522fb8ab-8d7b-4498-b39d-6911e2839253 - ${dataSteward1.id} approvers: - type: GROUP id: 788680b7-461d-493a-a3d6-86e71fd01ff2 - type: USER id: 3d174db4-4526-4469-2fda-46d0dd2a7f7d - type: USER id: ${dataSteward1.id} includeLocations: - datastore: 12345678-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95 - datastore: 80f33ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95 location: relationalLocation: db: db1 - datastore: 80f33ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95 location: requireApproverNote.description: Require from the approver an `approver note` when approving the request created from the defined rule. Defaults to `false`.

revokeIfNotUsedInDays.description: Revoke access if rule not used in the last given days. Zero = do not revoke. Max value is 180. Defaults to `0`.

satori:index/securityPolicy:SecurityPoli.description:
The Satori Security Policy is a re-usable object that can be configured to contain multiple sets of dynamic masking configurations and data filtering configurations.
A Security Policy can be applied to on one or more datasets.

The **security_policy** resource allows defining security policies.

attributes.description: User's set of attributes in JSON object format. may include the following types: int, string, float, boolean, string[], number[], where number may be float/int. The value may be a path to a json file that contains the attributes for a user or a raw JSON string, for example: "./attribute*files/user*a.json" OR "{"company": "SatoriCyber","age": 30.5,"cities": ["Washington", "Lisbon"],"kids_age": [1, 3.14759, 7], "isActive": true}"

satori:index/getUser:getUser.description:
The **satori_user** data source allows finding user ID by user email.

## Example Usage

<!--Start PulumiCodeChooser -->
```java
package generated_program;

import com.pulumi.Context;
import com.pulumi.Pulumi;
import com.pulumi.core.Output;
import com.pulumi.satori.SatoriFunctions;
import com.pulumi.satori.inputs.GetUserArgs;
import com.pulumi.satori.Dataset;
import com.pulumi.satori.DatasetArgs;
import com.pulumi.satori.inputs.DatasetDefinitionArgs;
import com.pulumi.satori.inputs.DatasetAccessControlSettingsArgs;
import com.pulumi.satori.inputs.DatasetCustomPolicyArgs;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Map;
import java.io.File;
import java.nio.file.Files;
import java.nio.file.Paths;

public class App {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Pulumi.run(App::stack);
    }

    public static void stack(Context ctx) {
        final var dataSteward1 = SatoriFunctions.getUser(GetUserArgs.builder()
            .email("data-steward@acme.organization")
            .build());

        var dataset1 = new Dataset("dataset1", DatasetArgs.builder()        
            .definition(DatasetDefinitionArgs.builder()
                .name("satori_dataset terraform test")
                .description("from satori terraform provider")
                .owners(                
                    "522fb8ab-8d7b-4498-b39d-6911e2839253",
                    dataSteward1.applyValue(getUserResult -> getUserResult.id()))
                .approvers(                
                    DatasetDefinitionApproverArgs.builder()
                        .type("GROUP")
                        .id("788680b7-461d-493a-a3d6-86e71fd01ff2")
                        .build(),
                    DatasetDefinitionApproverArgs.builder()
                        .type("USER")
                        .id("3d174db4-4526-4469-2fda-46d0dd2a7f7d")
                        .build(),
                    DatasetDefinitionApproverArgs.builder()
                        .type("USER")
                        .id(dataSteward1.applyValue(getUserResult -> getUserResult.id()))
                        .build())
                .includeLocations(                
                    DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder()
                        .datastore("12345678-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95")
                        .build(),
                    DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder()
                        .datastore("80f33ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95")
                        .location(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationArgs.builder()
                            .relationalLocation(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationRelationalLocationArgs.builder()
                                .db("db1")
                                .build())
                            .build())
                        .build(),
                    DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder()
                        .datastore("80f33ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95")
                        .location(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationArgs.builder()
                            .relationalLocation(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationRelationalLocationArgs.builder()
                                .db("db2")
                                .schema("schema1")
                                .build())
                            .build())
                        .build(),
                    DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder()
                        .datastore("80f33ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95")
                        .location(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationArgs.builder()
                            .relationalLocation(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationRelationalLocationArgs.builder()
                                .db("db2")
                                .schema("schema2")
                                .table("table")
                                .build())
                            .build())
                        .build())
                .excludeLocations(DatasetDefinitionExcludeLocationArgs.builder()
                    .datastore("80f33ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95")
                    .location(DatasetDefinitionExcludeLocationLocationArgs.builder()
                        .relationalLocation(DatasetDefinitionExcludeLocationLocationRelationalLocationArgs.builder()
                            .db("db2")
                            .schema("schema1")
                            .table("tableX")
                            .build())
                        .build())
                    .build())
                .build())
            .accessControlSettings(DatasetAccessControlSettingsArgs.builder()
                .enableAccessControl(false)
                .enableUserRequests(false)
                .enableSelfService(false)
                .build())
            .customPolicy(DatasetCustomPolicyArgs.builder()
                .rulesYaml(Files.readString(Paths.get(String.format("%s/rules.yaml", path.module()))))
                .tagsYaml(Files.readString(Paths.get(String.format("%s/tags.yaml", path.module()))))
                .build())
            .securityPolicies("56412aff-6ecf-4eff-9b96-2e0f6ec36c42")
            .build());

        // Example with different location types
        var dataset2 = new Dataset("dataset2", DatasetArgs.builder()        
            .definition(DatasetDefinitionArgs.builder()
                .name("satori_dataset terraform test")
                .description("from satori terraform provider")
                .owners(                
                    "522fb8ab-8d7b-4498-b39d-6911e2839253",
                    dataSteward1.applyValue(getUserResult -> getUserResult.id()))
                .includeLocations(                
                    DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder()
                        .datastore("12345678-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95")
                        .build(),
                    DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder()
                        .datastore("80f33ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95")
                        .location(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationArgs.builder()
                            .relationalLocation(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationRelationalLocationArgs.builder()
                                .db("db1")
                                .schema("schema1")
                                .build())
                            .build())
                        .build(),
                    DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder()

                        .location(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationArgs.builder()
                            .mongoLocation(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationMongoLocationArgs.builder()
                                .db("db1")
                                .collection("collection1")
                                .build())
                            .build())
                        .build(),
                    DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder()
                        .datastore("8kl43ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d508481049lw")
                        .location(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationArgs.builder()
                            .s3Location(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationLocationS3LocationArgs.builder()

                            .build())

                .excludeLocations(DatasetDefinitionExcludeLocationArgs.builder()

                .rulesYaml(Files.readString(Paths.get(String.format("%s/rules.yaml", path.module()))))
                .tagsYaml(Files.readString(Paths.get(String.format("%s/tags.yaml", path.module()))))
                .build())

            .definition(DatasetDefinitionArgs.builder()
                .name("satori_dataset terraform test")
                .description("from satori terraform provider")
                .owners(                
                    "522fb8ab-8d7b-4498-b39d-6911e2839253",
                    dataSteward1.applyValue(getUserResult -> getUserResult.id()))
                .includeLocations(                
                    DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder()
                        .datastore("12345678-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95")
                        .build(),
                    DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder()
                        .datastore("80f33ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95")
                        .relationalLocation(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationRelationalLocationArgs.builder()
                            .db("db1")
                            .build())
                        .build(),
                    DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder()
                        .datastore("80f33ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95")
                        .relationalLocation(DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationRelationalLocationArgs.builder()
                            .db("db2")
                            .schema("schema1")
                            .build())
                        .build(),
                    DatasetDefinitionIncludeLocationArgs.builder()
                        .datastore("80f33ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95")

                            .build())
                        .build())
                .excludeLocations(DatasetDefinitionExcludeLocationArgs.builder()
                    .datastore("80f33ff5-95cf-474f-a1d6-d5084810dd95")
                    .relationalLocation(DatasetDefinitionExcludeLocationRelationalLocationArgs.builder()
                        .db("db2")
                        .schema("schema1")

            .accessControlSettings(DatasetAccessControlSettingsArgs.builder()
                .enableAccessControl(false)
                .enableUserRequests(false)
                .enableSelfService(false)
                .build())
            .customPolicy(DatasetCustomPolicyArgs.builder()
                .rulesYaml(Files.readString(Paths.get(String.format("%s/rules.yaml", path.module()))))
```
